instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi,

i have mannaged to screw two <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards somehow. Both had some power issues, not working from battery... so i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and after replacement there was no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> any more. Chips are new and soldered with hot air. I get green and orange light. There is power on pins 1 and 3 of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>, but nothing on pin 2, also there is no power on output pins of <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>. I wonder if there is possible damage that i could have done with the heat, replacing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? because same thing happened with two boards. I dont know what to look for anymore, everything looks ok.

Thank you for any help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Was there PPBUS to start with? Why are they replaced?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yes, Mac was working, but just with power supply attached, thats why i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. So PPBUS was surely there before...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Almost sure bad solders on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
For new chip always apply leaded solder on its pads before place it on the board.
Now post resistance to ground on several points around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, pins 2, 4, 19, 20, <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>, F7140.
Do not power up the board again yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I have applied solder on the solder pads on the board.. and checked after soldering, joints look all good.

I have checked for resistance on points you suggested:

PIN 2     90kohm

PIN 4     600kohm

PIN 19   1,2Mohm

PIN 20   500kohm

<RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>    650kohm

F7140    On Pin 2 i get around 60 ohms and slowly dropping or in diode mode i get value 425. Pin 1 is 2,5kohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If pins 1 and 2 of F7140 are different then at least the fuse is blown....measure continuity of the fuse.

If all you did was change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> then it is most likely bad soldering, wrong orientation or killed the chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I desoldered the F7140 and then measured on both sides. I will try one more time with new chip...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
You were right... i have replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> again and now it works again and i am back to the primary problem, it still works only with charger attached. It sees battery, but it wont work from the battery. I have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, but it is still the same. Any suggestions?

Thank you for support.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Battery information in OSX? Cycle count, status, charge capacity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Voltage at pin15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Battery status is Good, 234 cycles and it has 96% capacity. On battery simbol there is message “Battery is not charging”.

I wonder if this has something to do with a water damage that was around <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3400</CHIP>? I replaced 2 capacitors there and recovered a burned connection to the <CAPACITOR>C3286</CAPACITOR>. I will replace a few capacitors there that look a little fishy... 

Now i also noticed click of the trackpad is not clicking all the time... as it would lose power every few seconds.

Voltage on pin15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is 0,2v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"Voltage on pin15 of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>[/URL] is 0,2v."
Did you measure with both battery and charger connected?
Looks like battery is charging...

Check <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52.
If battery is not really charging, that voltage should be less than 0.05V I think.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 0,2V on pin15 was measured with only charger connected. I will try with the battery too, if it is possible to connect it... and make a measure at the same time. Tomorrow i will make suggested... Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then 0.2V is too much there.
Check <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and traces between them and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Ok, i carefully replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> again and then i got 19,9V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. I decided to replace few capacitors that looked a little suspicious from the water damage and now the charger is somehow shorted. When i connect the charger it sparks on second pin and there is no light on charger. I removed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, but it is the same. I checked few capacitors that i replaced, they are not shorted...  still sparks on power connector when connected to charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Seems that you are using fake charger.
An original Apple one, will not power up the board if detects leakage/overload I think...

Check all MOSFETs from charger circuit.
I suspect shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, on high-side.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is still there, and pin24 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is properly soldered...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi again,

Shorted charger is solved, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was shorted. I use original 85w.

"Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=isl"]ISL[/URL]" - There is no resistance.

<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, resistors are ok, all traces are good.

<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is ok, but only around 4v there.

Now i have green/orange again,  at <CAPACITOR>C7105</CAPACITOR> there is 16,7 volts and around 4v at F7140, not steady, seems pulsing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/catalogsearch/result/?q=isl"]ISL[/URL]" - There is no resistance."
I refer to resistance value on 200ohm scale between these pins!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Sorry, the resistance 17/18 is 0,3-0,7ohm, 27/28 is 1,4-2,9 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Finally... i used <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> from a doner board and now i have 12,4v and CPU gets hot... will install it and see how is with the battery now. Maybe bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> was killing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Still didnt work from the battery and then i put it in another housing... and it works there!? It is a battery problem after all. Interesting, because this was not water damaged. Does apple has some extra warranty for these batteries? Lesson learned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: No warranties. Just get another battery. A1582 batteries are still of decent quality for the time being. But real new ones don't exist of course only reset pulled shit from China.
